author: Luisa A. Igloria
text: And the high winds bore down, and the sky
The taverns by the sea closed their shutters,
and the stands selling battered fries,
On the boardwalk, pieces of salt-water taffy, half-
eaten funnel cakes oozing grease and cream:
And the people on every highway, panicked, sought
a clear route for their exodus:
What’s in your emergency backpack? Beef jerky, mineral
water, flashlight, solar cells? Snap in the sound of
Yesterday, white and blue sails pretty on the water;
sharp glint of skyscraper glass. Then this
title: Derecho Ghazal
